duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform radiographic procedures and related techniques, producing images for interpretation by licensed practitioners.
Supervise and evaluate radiology students assigned to them.
Exercise professional judgment in the performance of services and maintain demeanor complementary to medical ethics.
Provide patient care, assess patient conditions, and ensure patient safety and security.
Operate X-ray equipment in accordance with State and Federal Codes, utilizing proper film, screen, film holders, grids, and exposure factors.
Evaluate requisitions, provide patient care, and maintain patient dignity and modesty.
Maintain patient care through standard precautions and transmission-based precautions, and assess patient conditions at regular intervals.
Operate functions of HIS/RIS in accordance with Hospital and Department policy, pursue appropriate continuing education, and perform daily quality assurance activity.
Acquire 12 educational credits annually and perform mechanical and electrical safety checks on applicable equipment prior to use each day.

education_certification.credential: Current New York State licensure to practice Diagnostic Radiography.
Registered with the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT). (Employees hired prior to January 2001 are excluded from this requirement)
Completion of a two-year approved ARRT School.
